column1: Milo Burrows was a hobbit of the Shire.
Milo was a grandson of Gorbadoc Brandybuck of Buckland
column2: who married into the Baggins Family when he wedded Peony Baggins
column3: a distant cousin of both Bilbo and Frodo Baggins. They had four children - Mosco Burrows
column5: Myrtle Burrows and Minto Burrows - and all of the family was present at Bilbos famous Bilbos Farewell Party.

column1: Milo was known for his habit of failing to reply to letters
column2: and because of this he was one of those that found a specially selected gift waiting for him in Bag End
column3: after Bilbos departure: a golden inkpot and pen.

column1: 1990: The Lord of the Rings: Volume 1:
:A Hobbit named Milo warns Frodo Baggins of wolves that are about in the Shire.
2002: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game):

column2: voiced by an uncredited Michael Reisz
column4: Bagshot Row. He expresses pleasure that Frodo is no longer associating with "Elves and Wizards"
column5: causing Frodo to politely make his excuses and leave.
